project.name: Firebrick JS API
project.description: Firebrick JS API: A lightweight JavaScript MVC Framework powered with jQuery, Bootstrap, Knockout JS and Require JS

Firebrick.name: Firebrick
Firebrick.description: A lightweight JavaScript MVC Framework powered with jQuery, Knockout JS and Require JS

Firebrick.name: Firebrick

classitems.description: used to store configurations set Firebrick.ready()
classitems.name: app.name

classitems.description: ready function to kick start the application
classitems.name: application

props.name: autoRender
props.description: {Boolean} whether to call first view automatically  "{app.name}.view.Index",

props.name: viewData
props.description: {Object} viewData to be passed to the autoRender view,

props.name: splash
props.description: {String} - html or string to be rendered before the document is loaded - removed on document.ready

props.name: require
props.description: {String, Array of Strings} file(s) are required

props.name: cache
props.description: {Boolean} [cache=true] whether require should cache files or not,

props.name: dev
props.description: {Boolean} [dev=false] true to print requirejs exceptions to console

classitems.description: show stackTrace at any given point by creating an error. This will only work if the application is in "dev" mode.
classitems.name: stackTrace

params.name: force
params.description: [default=false] set to true to force the stacktrace in prod mode too

this is used in conjunction with "scrollTo" url parameter.
This is needed if you have a fixed header for example and the browser
scroll the anchor to position 0 which is behind the header - effectively cutting off content

classitems.description: checks the callback function to see whether the parameter _defaults was declared for the function
classitems.name: _hasParameterDefined

classitems.description:
this function checks whether the callback has the method _defaults declared are a paramter.
if not: the _defaults method is called after the callback is fired
if yes: the _defaults method is passed to the callback as an argument, which must then be manually called
used by callRoute()
classitems.name: _routeCallback

classitems.description: call this after setting router.set({}) if you wish to do an immediate evaulation of url
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Check whether the url matches a pattern - removes any parameters in the url to check for a match
classitems.name: is

return.description:
{
						href: "http://localhost/#/mypath/dayone?user=1",
						origin: "http://localhost"
						path: "/#/mypath/dayone?user=1",	// (href - origin)
						cleanPath: "/mypath/dayone",	//non hash routes
						hash: "#/mypath/dayone?user=1",		//window.location.hash
						cleanHash: "#/mypath/dayone"
						parameters:{}		//url parameter as object
					}

classitems.type: {String, Object} string :: only a get store - i.e. 1-way store, get information from the server. object :: mutliple directional store - get and send information to and from the server

classitems.description:
Store status
1. initial :: store has just been created
2. preload :: store is just about to fire the $.ajax event
3. any :: success status of $.ajax()
